intro: Monnina sodiroana, commonly known as the redstem leadplant, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces bright red or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-tolerant nature. Monnina sodiroana is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping.
